page.title: 04BURHAM - THE GAMEKEEPER
page.content: Burham village is situated at the base of the chalk scarp slope of the North Downs where the River Medway cuts through them from South to North. The land around and above the village, to the North and East is owned by the Blue Circle Cement Company. Its use is three fold; agricultural farmed by tenant farmers; forestry, controlled by the Forestry Commission; and shooting. Three thousand five hundred acres are controlled by a gamekeeper. We were able to interview him to discover what this unusual job, only 1 of 3000 in the country, entails. He lives in a lodge on the crest of the Downs in woodland which is not easily accessible by road.
